intro: Sterculia petenensis, commonly known as the Petén sterculia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
